articles.author: Kirsti Knolle
articles.description: German conservatives under likely next chancellor Friedrich Merz vowed on Monday to move quickly to try to form a coalition after winning the most votes in a national election that saw far-right and far-left parties gain support from disaffected voters.
articles.title: Merz's conservatives push for quick coalition talks after German election win

articles.author: Tom Balmforth, Olena Harmash
articles.description: Beyond the war of words, U.S. officials opened direct talks with the Russian side in Saudi Arabia last week, shutting out Kyiv and Europe in a stunning change of policy on the war.
articles.title: Ukraine hemmed in as US backing frays three years after Russian invasion

articles.author: Antoni Slodkowski
articles.description: China's President Xi Jinping reaffirmed his "no limits" partnership in a phone call with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday, China's state media reported, on the third anniversary of Russia's full-scale invasion of Ukraine.
articles.title: Xi affirms 'no limits' partnership with Putin in call on Ukraine war anniversary

articles.author: Stephen Eisenhammer, Laura Gottesdiener
articles.description: U.S. President Donald Trump's sweeping foreign aid freeze has stalled a United Nations program in Mexico aimed at stopping imported fentanyl chemicals from reaching the country's drug cartels, according to eight people familiar with the situation. It’s one of several U.S. counternarcotics efforts in Mexico derailed in recent weeks by the stop-work order.
articles.title: Trump aid freeze disrupts anti-narcotics program at Mexican ports

articles.author: Andy Sullivan, Jonathan Landay
articles.description: U.S. government workers who have been buffeted by President Donald Trump's chaotic return to power face more uncertainty on Monday, when many of them will be required to justify their jobs to Elon Musk, the chainsaw-wielding billionaire tasked with slashing the federal budget.
articles.title: Some US government workers told to justify their jobs to Musk, others told to ignore him

articles.author: David Lawder
articles.description: Canada and Mexico are expected to intensify efforts this week to avoid punishing 25% tariffs on their exports to the U.S. in talks to persuade President Donald Trump's administration that their steps to increase border security and curb fentanyl trafficking are working ahead of a March 4 deadline.
articles.title: Canada, Mexico to step up fentanyl, border talks this week to avoid Trump's tariffs

articles.author: Timour Azhari, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Hundreds of Syrians will gather in Damascus on Tuesday for a one-day national dialogue conference, billed by the country's Islamist rulers as a key milestone in the transition to a new political system after decades of Assad rule.
articles.title: Syria to hold dialogue conference amid criticism over inclusivity

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Germany's likely next chancellor Friedrich Merz said on Monday he had invited Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to visit and would find a way for him to do so without being arrested under a warrant by the International Criminal Court.
articles.title: Merz says he will find a way for Netanyahu to visit Germany without being arrested

articles.author: Juliette Jabkhiro
articles.description: A former surgeon accused of raping or sexually assaulting hundreds of young patients, some while they were under anaesthetic, went on trial on Monday in France's largest ever child sexual abuse case.
articles.title: Retired surgeon goes on trial in France's biggest child sex abuse case

articles.author: Andrew Gray, Lili Bayer
articles.description: "Worried" European foreign ministers said on Monday the region had entered a new era with U.S. President Donald Trump's stunning reversal of decades of U.S. foreign policy, but that they still hoped the relationship with Washington could endure.
articles.title: Trump leaves Europe facing up to 'new era'
